section.title: Access control lists
section.para: An access control list, or ACL for short, is a database table that configures authorization. An ACL pairs identities with foreign keys to other objects, and RLS policies check that suitable such pairs exist in the ACL.

note.para: Not all authorization checks use ACLs. ACLs are used only for associating identities to other objects, such as journals. Authorization checks that do not need ACLs are implemented differently.
